title: John Allen (sportsman, born 1974)
text:
John Aubrey Allen (born 19 July 1974) is an Australian teacher, rugby player and <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er.
Allen was born in <a href="Windsor%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Windsor, New South Wales</a>. He attended <a href="Bede%20Polding%20College">Bede Polding College</a> in <a href="South%20Windsor%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">South Windsor</a>, before graduating with a <a href="Bachelor%27s%20degree">BA</a> in human movement studies at the <a href="University%20of%20Technology%20Sydney">University of Technology Sydney</a>, where he also completed his <a href="Diploma%20of%20Education">Diploma of Education</a>. He played rugby for several clubs, most notably for the <a href="Brumbies">Brumbies</a> who he represented in the <a href="Australian%20Provincial%20Championship">Ricoh Championship</a>. He also played <a href="Grade%20cricket">Grade cricket</a> for <a href="Hawkesbury%20Cricket%20Club">Hawkesbury Cricket Club</a> near Sydney. At 21, he moved to England to study for his <a href="master%27s%20degree">master's degree</a> at <a href="University%20College%2C%20Oxford">University College, Oxford</a>. While at Oxford, Allen was awarded his <a href="Blue%20%28university%20sport%29">blue</a> in <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and cricket.
Allen played as a <a href="centre%20%28rugby%20union%29">centre</a> in rugby union and as a <a href="forward%20%28rugby%20league%29">forward</a> in rugby league. He captained <a href="Oxford%20University%20RFC">Oxford University RFC</a> in 2003, leading the team to a draw in <a href="The%20Varsity%20Match">The Varsity Match</a> against <a href="Cambridge%20University%20R.U.F.C.">Cambridge</a> at <a href="Twickenham%20Stadium">Twickenham</a> in December that year. Earlier in the year, he scored a try late in the game to seal Oxford's victory in the <a href="Rugby%20League%20Varsity%20Match">Rugby League Varsity Match</a> at the <a href="Athletic%20Ground%2C%20Richmond">Athletic Ground, Richmond</a>.
For <a href="Oxford%20University%20Cricket%20Club">Oxford University Cricket Club</a>, he played in two <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> matches, including the <a href="varsity%20match">varsity match</a>.
After completing his master's, Allen returned to teaching in Australia and in 2017 was working as Director of Sport and Co-Curricular at <a href="Trinity%20Grammar%20School%20%28New%20South%20Wales%29">Trinity Grammar School</a> in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>.
